curam.util.dataaccess

Class AuditMappingsHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.dataaccess.AuditMappingsHelper

  • public abstract class AuditMappingsHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class for audit mappings. There will be zero or one instances of a subclass of this class per application. This abstract class caches references to setter methods in the handcrafted audit mappings class for the application, and defines abstract methods whose implementation will be provided in the generated audit mappings factory class. This mechanism enables meta-data about the fields, such as their name, type and whether they should be excluded from inserts or updates to be conveyed from the input meta-model to the built application.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AuditMappingsHelper

        public AuditMappingsHelper()

    • Method Detail

      • initializeSetters

        protected void initializeSetters(java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Object> auditMappingsClass)
                          throws AppRuntimeException
        Initializes the audit mappings setter methods. Finds all setter methods implemented in the audit mappings class and stores them for later invocation.
        Parameters:
        auditMappingsClass - The audit mappings class type.
        Throws:
        AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_ERROR_AMBIGUOUS_AUDITMAPPING_SETTER_METHOD If the class contains more than one method whose signature matches `setXXXX(boolean, boolean)` because we can only call one such method.

      • createAuditMappingsInstance

        public abstract java.lang.Object createAuditMappingsInstance()
        Creates an instance of the audit mappings implementation class for the application. The implementation of this method will be generated and will ensure that the appropriate class is instantiated and returned.
        Returns:
        A new instance of the audit mappings implementation class.

      • getFieldNames

        public abstract java.lang.String[] getFieldNames()
        Gets the names of the fields in the audit mappings class. The implementation of this method will be produced by the generator.
        Returns:
        An array of field names.

      • shouldExcludeFieldFromStatement

        public abstract boolean shouldExcludeFieldFromStatement(java.lang.String fieldName,
                                                        boolean isInsert,
                                                        boolean isModify)
        Indicates whether a field should be excluded from an operation, based on the type of the operation (insert/modify) and whether the audit mapping field has been designated insert-only or modify-only.

        Used when setting up the database call descriptor for an operation at which time the field may need to be excluded.

        The implementation of this method will be produced by the generator.

        Parameters:
        fieldName - The name of the field.
        isInsert - Indicates that this is an insert operation.
        isModify - Indicates that this is an update operation.
        Returns:
        True if the field should be excluded from the statement.
